15 // Stops ROS if it has been started.
16 // See ROS Namespace, QThread.
17 void ROSnode::end() {
18  if ( connected() ) {
19  motion_ctrl->stopMotion();
20  if ( ros::isStarted() ) {
21  ros::shutdown(); // stops ROS, and thus the run() method
22  ros::waitForShutdown(); // waits for ROS to stop
23  }
24  wait(); // waits for the run() method (other thread) to stop
25  motion_ctrl = NULL;
26  } // end of if (connected)
27 } // end of ROSnode::~ROSnode() --------------------------------------
28 
29 /* Common part of the two initialisation methods
30  * Parameter: ctrl the motion controller.
31  * See ROS Namespace, ROS::Publisher, QThread,
32  * init(), init(const std::string&, const std::string&).
33  */
34 void ROSnode::ROSsetup(Controller& ctrl) {
35  if ( ros::master::check() ) {
36  motion_ctrl = &ctrl;
37  ros::NodeHandle nh;
38  // explicitly needed since our nodehandle is going out of scope
39  ros::start();
40  // set the publisher used to send the commands (velocities)
41  cmd_publisher = nh.advertise<geometry_msgs::Twist>
42  ("cmd_vel_mux/input/teleop", 10);
43  // subscrive to the odometry topic,
44  // and start new_odom method with each new data
45  odom_subscriber = nh.subscribe("/odom", 1000,
46  &ROSnode::newOdometry, this);
47  start(); // starts the process, and calls run()
48  } // end of if (is_connected)
49 } // end of void ROSnode::ROSsetup() ---------------------------------
50 
51 // Sends the odometry data to the controller.
52 // Parameter: odom the new odometry data.
53 // See Controller::newState().
54 void ROSnode::newOdometry(const nav_msgs::Odometry::ConstPtr& odom) {
55  const ros::Time& t = odom->header.stamp;
56  const double date = t.sec + 1E-9 * t.nsec;
57  static const double initial_date = date;
58  const geometry_msgs::Pose& pose = odom->pose.pose;
59  const geometry_msgs::Point& point = pose.position;
60  const geometry_msgs::Quaternion& orient = pose.orientation;
61  const tf::Quaternion tfQuat(orient.x, orient.y, orient.z, orient.w);
62  const tf::Matrix3x3 tfMatrix(tfQuat);
63  const geometry_msgs::Twist& twist = odom->twist.twist;
64  double roll, pitch, yaw;
65  tfMatrix.getRPY(roll, pitch, yaw);
66  const State
67  state(date - initial_date, Config(Point(point.x, point.y), yaw),
68  twist.linear.x, twist.angular.z);
69  motion_ctrl->newState(state);
70 } // end of void ROSnode::newOdometry(const nav_msgs:...:ConstPtr&) --
71 
72 /* Main loop of the process (in a separate thread).
73  *
74  * See QThread, ROS::Rate, stop(), geometry_msgs::Twist,
75  * ROS Namespace, log(const LogLevel&, const std::string&),
76  * ROS::Publisher, ROSshutdown().
77  */
78 void ROSnode::run() {
79  if ( connected() ) {
80  const double loop_frequ = 1 / motion_ctrl->timeStep();
81  // defined from input stream, if any
82  ros::Rate loop_rate(loop_frequ);
83  geometry_msgs::Twist vel;
84 
85  motion_ctrl->stopMotion(); // Sets the velocities to zero.
86  while ( ros::ok() ) {
87  std::ostringstream log_msg;
88  motion_ctrl->chooseVelocities(vel.linear.x, vel.angular.z,
89  log_msg);
90  log( Info, log_msg.str() );
91  cmd_publisher.publish(vel); // publish the commands
92  // spin ROS once, and wait for next time step
93  ros::spinOnce();
94  loop_rate.sleep();
95  } // end of while (ROS OK)
96  } // end of if (connected)
97 } // end of void ROSnode::run() --------------------------------------
98 
99 /* Connects to ROS server with parameters.
100  *
101  * Parameters: master_url the URI of the ROS master,
102  * host_url the URI of the host,
103  * ctrl the motion controller.
104  *
105  * See ROS Namespace, ROSsetup().
106  */
107 void ROSnode::init(const std::string &master_url,
108  const std::string &host_url, Controller& ctrl) {
109  std::map<std::string,std::string> remappings;
110  remappings["__master"] = master_url;
111  remappings["__hostname"] = host_url;
112  ros::init(remappings,"qt_ctrl");
113  ROSsetup(ctrl);
114 } // end of void ROSnode::init(const std::string&, ..., Controller&) -
115 
116 /* Writes a message at given level in the log.
117  *
118  * Parameters: level the log's severity level,
119  * msg the message.
120  *
121  * See ROS::console, ROS::Time, QStringListModel,
122  * connected(), loggingModel(), loggingUpdated().
123  */
124 void ROSnode::log(const LogLevel &level, const std::string &msg) {
125  static const char* levelName[Count] =
126  {"DEBUG", "INFO", "WARN", "ERROR", "FATAL"};
127  std::stringstream log_model_msg;
128 
129  if ( connected() && (level < Count) && ( !msg.empty() ) ) {
130  // fills ROS log at the requested level
131  ROS_LOG_STREAM(level, ROSCONSOLE_DEFAULT_NAME, msg);
132  // change the GUI log: insert a line in the GUI log
133  log_model.insertRows(log_model.rowCount(),1);
134  // write the formated (add level and date) message
135  log_model_msg << "[" << levelName[(int)(level)] << "] ["
136  << ros::Time::now() << "]: " << msg;
137  // transform the string stream into a QVariant (= union)
138  QVariant new_row( QString( log_model_msg.str().c_str() ) );
139  // add it as the last line of the log
140  log_model.setData(log_model.index(log_model.rowCount()-1), new_row);
141  Q_EMIT loggingUpdated(); // ask the GUI to show its log
142  } // end of if (connected, valid level & message non empty)
143 } // end of void ROSnode::log(const LogLevel&, const std::string &) --
